meanings.definition: The breaking down of cells by biological processes.
meanings.sent1: The biolyses of the cells helped in the study of biology.
meanings.sent2: Scientists observed the biolyses of the cells under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The biolyses of the cells in the lab made the students curious about science.
meanings.sent4: The biolyses of the cells was like a tiny demolition crew at work.
meanings.sent5: The biolyses of the cells resembled a slow but steady dismantling process.

meanings.definition: The decomposition of organic matter by living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The biolyses of the organic matter in the forest nourished the soil.
meanings.sent2: Farmers rely on the biolyses of organic matter for natural fertilization.
meanings.sent3: The biolyses of the organic matter created a rich ecosystem in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The biolyses of the organic matter transformed the landscape over time.
meanings.sent5: The biolyses of the organic matter was like nature's recycling program in action.
